oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Souvenir de Henry M. Suckley tué à Koritza : framed calligraphic remembrance
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: M. LeParmantier
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Ornamental calligraphic remembrance of Henry Eglinton Montgomery Suckley's service in the American Ambulance Field Service for France and for losing his life in Koritza, Albania. In circular gilt frame. Depicts a five-pointed star made of leaf- or bud-like forms in gilt, silver, green, and red. Inside the star is a metallic-silver colored Latin cross, two quotes from the Bible, and an inscription in remembrance of Henry E.M. Suckley.

oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Suckley, Henry Eglinton Montgomery, 1887-1917
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dated: 1915-1917. The ablum contains photos taken by Henry while serving in the American Ambulance Field Service in France. Black leather photograph album with sewn binding and black pages (10 1/4 x 12 1/8 x 1 in). Silver gelatin prints include both printed and developed out processes. Various formats including autographic photos measuring 1 3/4 x 2 3/4 in. to larger photos measuring 4 x 5 in. and other sizes as well are mounted on pages.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Diary of Henry Eglinton Montgomery Suckley: December 26, 1916 - February 4, 1917
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Suckley, Henry Eglinton Montgomery, 1887-1917
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Agenda book belonging to Henry Eglinton Montgomery Suckley used as a diary of events personal as well as events related to his service as the leader of Section 10 of the American Field Service. Dated entries from 1916-12-26 to 1917-2-4 mainly relate the relocation of Section 10 by ship (S. S. Lotus) across the Mediterranean Sea. Henry's group, along with other sections of the American Field Service, departed from Marseilles, France on January 3, 1917 and arrived in the harbor of Salonika on January 8, 1917.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918--Salonika

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter, Henry Eglinton Montgomery Suckley to Robert Bowne Suckley, February 2, 1915
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Suckley, Henry Eglinton Montgomery, 1887-1917
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter on stationery from The American Hospital of Paris from Henry Eglinton Montgomery Suckley to his father, Robert Bowne Suckley. Though recognizing the hardships that await him, Henry assures his father that he will be in little danger when he becomes actively engaged in the volunteer ambulance effort. Henry also recounts the retreat of the English Red Cross from Mons.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Croix de Guerre (1917)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Maltese cross with medallion in center. On the medallion is a head with a laurel wreath surrounded by the words "Republique Francaise." Behind the cross are two swords with points up. The medal is suspended from a ribbon of six wide green and seven narrow red stripes. A metal bar goes through the top of the ribbon upon which is attached a metal five pointed star. The back of the medal is marked "1914 / 1916"

The French Republic posthumously awarded this military decoration to Henry Eglinton Montgomery Suckley on 10 October 1917. While serving with the American Ambulance Field Service as a volunteer ambulance driver, Henry was killed by a German bomb.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Medals; World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918--Medals
Suckley, Henry Eglinton Montgomery, 1887-1917
oai_dc:dc.dc:relation: Suckley Family World War I Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: Wilderstein Preservation holds copyright and reproduction rights. Permission for reproduction required. http://www.wilderstein.org

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Croix de Guerre (1915)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Maltese cross with medallion in center. On the medallion is a head with a laurel wreath surrounded by the words "Republique Francaise." Behind the cross are two swords with points up. The medal is suspended from a ribbon of six wide green and seven narrow red stripes. A metal bar goes through the top of the ribbon upon which is attached a metal five pointed star. The back of the medal is marked "1914 / 1916"

The French Republic awarded this military decoration to members of Section 3 of the American Ambulance Field Service in recognition for services rendered October 15 - 17, 1915. Henry Eglinton Montgomery Suckley was a member of Section 3 at this time.
